alert.note: Alert for Harnett; Johnston; Nash (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 7:04AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Harnett, Johnston, Nash and Wilson. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of urban areas, rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 701 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Rainfall amounts of 2 inches or more are possible in an hour or two. This rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Smithfield, Lillington, Wilson, Clayton, Dunn, Angier, Benson, Bailey, Micro, Selma, Erwin, Coats, Four Oaks, Pine Level, Kenly, Princeton, Lucama, Middlesex, Stantonsburg and Black Creek.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. If you are driving, slow down and use caution to avoid hydroplaning.
